title: 2 Simple Ways to Disable and Turn Off AirDrop

steps.title: Open the Control Center.
steps.content: Open the Control Center . On iPhone X or later, swipe down on the top-right corner of the screen. On iPhone 8 and earlier (and iPhone SE), swipe up from the bottom of the screen. On an iPad with iOS 12 or later, swipe down from the top-right of the screen.

steps.title: Tap and hold the network settings tile.
steps.content: Tap and hold the network settings tile. This will be in the top-left corner. You can tap and hold any icon in the network settings tile; this will expand it.

steps.title: Tap and hold the AirDrop icon.
steps.content: Tap and hold the AirDrop icon. You can find this below the Wi-Fi icon.

steps.title: Tap Receiving Off.
steps.content: Tap Receiving Off . AirDrop will be turned off until you turn it on again. [1] X Research source You can also do this in Settings → General → AirDrop → Receiving Off . When you want to transfer files again, you can turn AirDrop on again by tapping the icon in the Control Center.

steps.title: Open the Control Center.
steps.content: Open the Control Center. Click the toggle icon in the top-right corner of the menu bar. This will be between the search icon and date.

steps.title: Click AirDrop.
steps.content: Click AirDrop . The icon will be blue if it's currently enabled. Clicking the icon again will disable AirDrop and turn the icon grey. [2] X Research source You can also disable AirDrop in the Finder . In the Finder sidebar, click AirDrop → Allow me to be discovered by → No One .
